result.execSummary:
The defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon-Falsify Info (A/B/C/D), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent with 15CF2387.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court costs,  victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 7/11/2021.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No volations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause (as to probation).
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
*Court does not suspend the defendant's drivers license.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to case #15CF2387, credit for 0 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
 IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 5 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
 (as to probation)
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Work or school
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/11/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/11/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
-Court does not suspend the defendant's drivers license
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconvicion Relief

Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr.  
Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

 Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

On parties request, case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Per state and defense, case adjourned for bail bond hearing on 4/18/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Parties are requesting that this case be rescheduled for 3/8/16 at 8:30 am. sab

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. At the request of both parties, plea and sentencing scheduled for 12/11/2015 at 8:30 a.m. has been rescheduled to 3/3/2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody at HOC.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state informs the court that the defendant has not decided if he wishes to enter into a cooperation agreement with the state.  State is asking that this matter be set after the co-defendant's dates.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 SB.
Case set for final pretrial on 9-1-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 9-21-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be testifying for the state in another matter which is set for trial  9-14-2015.  Defendant has VOP and also new drug charges pending; defense counsel asks for time to review new charges prior to scheduling matter.  Case set for pretrial/status.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Gregory Roger Parr in court, defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendant Andrew Scholz

Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Claytin Edward Krimmer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
